Reviews.Title: “Great location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: John S
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in between LA and Hollywood. So make me my and my wife easy to go town and leisure. Had a good time last month on our vacation to Hollywood and LA. The hotel is in good location with free parking.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money, and very convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: Cyborg17
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for a night when I was visiting L.A., was on a road trip and wanted to see Hollywood. Primary requirements was not to waste a lot of time driving in city traffic. The hotel is at a very good location, a very short drive to highways so no city traffic. Free parking, and a 10 minutes walk to the subway station. I expected a small room, but was surprised to find a very descent sized room with comfortable bed, clean bathroom, and a TV that worked well :). For a city location, and a descent price.., I wouldn't have expected more. Parked the car, and then took the subway to go to downtown for sightseeing, visited Hollywood spots. Nice eateries nearby as well. Overall, a descent experience.. a good and quiet place to rest for the night. The reception staff was nice as well, and the vending machine and ice machine helped quenching the late night thirst !!

Reviews.Title: “Very value priced.”
Reviews.Author: Paul191
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in excellent shape, and the staff treated me like a family member. I would definitely return. I was there for a two week stay, and all the staff was super nice. The room was cleaned thoroughly every day, and the rate was great for the area. Thanks for making my stay so enjoyable. Special thanks to the front desk staff.

Reviews.Title: “Just conveniently located.”
Reviews.Author: Luceida
Reviews.Content: This Hotel has nothing memorable. We went to this hotel for Los Angeles Half marathon, and chose it because it was conventiently located near a metro station for transportation from the finish line and it was near some Hollywood attractions... the room was not clean, the smell was awful and the hotel seems a little bit unkempt... the only thing good about it is that the room was big.. that's it.

Reviews.Title: “OK but nothing out of the box”
Reviews.Author: auzzigirls
Reviews.Content: A Clean room with a distant view of the hollywood sign. Pleasant staff. Reasonable bed, however the bath towels had a lot to be desired, they were very very small and paper thin. No hand towels, face washers or tissues in the room. The towels were like paper, so thin and the sheet had a cigarette lke burn in it, but appart from that it was just ok!!, Area in which it is located is just 1 1/2 mile from Chinese theatre area, free parking supplied so you can catch a bus if you want up town. The area is not that desirable, but ok if you just want a place to bed down for the night. A light continent breakfast was supplied and was ok.

Reviews.Title: “I was pretty clean and the people were nice”
Reviews.Author: k_boehm
Reviews.Content: The only thing that puzzles me is that a smoking room at this place is cheaper than a non-smoking room by quite a bit. The rooms were small but had what they needed, The closet has an exterior bar hanging in the room. But the bathroom was clean and the location was nice and seemed safe, we didn't have any problems. I think I would stay here again if I needed a place in hollywood, it was the best priced by quite a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money + Perfect Location If you have a car!”
Reviews.Author: rickster08
Reviews.Content: I'll keep it short and sweet. This place is great value for money! We were given a double sized room with a far distant view of the hollywood sign! A little touch that was nice! Like all of LA, its best you have a car. We had only 2.5 days in LA from Vegas so had a car to go around everywhere! The location was fine. At first we were a bit sceptical because this motel does fall on the lesser part of Hollywood, a little away from the glam but nonetheless it was still safe and seem to be quite busy! Overall was pleased with our stay here and probably would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great value for money”
Reviews.Author: MJ4021
Reviews.Content: It was the second time we stayed in this hotel (the first one was in September 2009) and we were invariably satisfied. First of all, the hotel is perfectly located to visit most of the LA highlights. For example, Hollywood & Highlands and the Walk of Fame are within a walking distance and the Griffiths Observatory or the film studios are only 10 mins by car. Right next to the hotel there's a 24h pharmacy and store, as well as some food facilities. In general you may find tramps and hobos everywhere in LA, and Hollywood is not an exception (do not confuse Hollywood and Beverly Hills), but on no occasion did we feel unsafe around the hotel. The hotel itself is a very good value for money. Can't really speak for the queen size bedrooms, but the king size bedrooms we had were spacious, clean and had all the facilities necessary for a short stay. Breakfast was basic and simple but sufficient for a quick kick-off. On top of that the reception staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “The time of my life”
Reviews.Author: Traveler0508
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel staff was great and Mina she was so great and beautiful too. She helped us in places to go and what to do. The rooms were so nice and clean. I will be back thank you for a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To stay”
Reviews.Author: koolguy101
Reviews.Content: I travel for 90% of my business. I know what a good or even average hotel should offer This was the perfect great place for my colleges and I. We basically needed clean rooms that are big and be able to have your privacy and on top of that there service was great :].

Reviews.Title: “Great place to visit”
Reviews.Author: Lyss028
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for Christmas and was pleasantly surprised.great central location clean rooms and friendly folks. Glad I choSe the super 8.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Leebee9
Reviews.Content: We needed a cost effective motel in LA and after reading several reviews this place won out. The location is pretty good as its close to shops, metro and Hollywood and Sunset. The carparking is a little small and I was a bit worried about security but we didnt have any problems. The room was adequate. Mostly clean and functional and the free wifi worked well. Good to have a fridge. On the first night we only had two towels and no hand towel, bathmat or facecloth but that was rectified on for the second nigh. No issues with the area or dodgy people staying in the hotel. Hollywood is what it is and never felt unsafe stepping outside our room or the hotel. Breakfast was probably the places biggest let down. The area didnt look clean and the selection was terrible with stale Cheerios and pastries. However it was included in the price and got us started for the day. Overall I would recommend this place to people looking for a cost effective motel in a handy location.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to Stay if You Don't Plan to Stay in Room Long”
Reviews.Author: hayley_yuill
Reviews.Content: My friend and I did a roadtrip to California and stayed in Super 8's all the way down. The location of this one was convienient. Not the most comfortable area for 2 young women as there is a bar right beneath the hotel. Just exercise caution when going out at night. Close to Hollywood Blvd and Sunset. We spent as much time out as we could. Room was quite small and decor was not nearly as nice as the other Super 8's we'd stayed in. And there were ANTS...crawling all over the bathroom, in the sink etc. Parking lot is extremely tight! The breakfast was simple (toast, cereal etc.) but good. We had a pretty neat view of the Hollywood sign from our room on the 3rd floor facing Western Ave. And despite the area, I slept like a baby. No sirens or screaming etc. We ordered room service one night, it took about 45 mins as it comes from an outside catering company, but it was delicious! And they even phoned us the next morning to ensure we enjoying everything. All in all, it was decent for 2 girls traveling on a tight budget. Had we planned to spend more time in our hotel, we would have invested in something a lot nicer. But you're in Los Angeles, you should be out doing things anyways!

Reviews.Title: “Scary... bad bad area”
Reviews.Author: missitty
Reviews.Content: A few friends and I stayed here after Traveling to LA for a concert. This place lacks security and there were drug dealers trying to push their products inside of the hotel. This place is Scary. The neighborhood was frightening and there were also prostitutes and homeless/addicts all over the place and renting rooms in the hotel. The desk guy looked at my friends attire (faux fur coat) and assumed he was a pimp and that we were prostitutes and seemed surprised that we had made reservations for more than one night. He kept giving us this strange smile... icky. This place left me with a bad feeling. If you want to stay here to save a few bucks my advice is to utilize the buddy system whenever you leave your room to visit the vending machines... after checking in for the night that is probably the only thing you will feel even moderately safe doing. eek. I can deal with scary hotels but this place is a disaster waiting to happen. Be safe if you book a room. Parents... please do not bring children here. This is no place for kids.

Reviews.Title: “not perfect but ok for the price.”
Reviews.Author: toasteure
Reviews.Content: i remembered that i was a little bit afraid when we checked-in. the hotel was so... BROWN. put some color...a painting job please! the room is NOT a romantic suite with plasma and silk. no, it's not. but the room is ok. clean sheets, clean bathroom, fridge in room and WiFi available. what else do we need? the perfect carpet!? no. we don't need that. from our room, we had the chance to see the hollywood sign. the neigborhood is not fun. late at night, i was a little afraid. however, it's close to fast food and grocery stores. metro station (western, i think) is not far away (about 5min). the breakfast was good. (donuts, toasts, coffee, tea, cereals, fruits...) we enjoyed our stay there. actually, we'll go back to this hotel next time we'll go to los angeles. it's not the perfect place but it's ok!

Reviews.Title: “Saved our day!!”
Reviews.Author: Dohme
Reviews.Content: We had booked to stay in the Americas Best Value Inn on South Alvarado Street and the area was dreadful! So we quickly got out of there and booked into this Super 8. The location was perfect - walking distance to Hollywood Blvd and other sites. The hotel was clean, fridge in room and WiFi available. Really enjoyed our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Super 8 is Super Bad!”
Reviews.Author: beantown72
Reviews.Content: Do NOT stay here no matter what bargain you are looking for in Hollywood! The neighborhood is shady, the place is sleezy, the rooms are rundown and small, and the bed is like a board. Even the bathroom towels were thin and worn out. By far the worst hotel I've ever been in. You've been warned.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth your Money”
Reviews.Author: mmj0817
Reviews.Content: Hotel is seedy, elevater smelled urine, gave me a room at the 3rd floor. Hall way is very dirty , room even more dirty. Check out the same day. Not comfortable staying at this motel. Shame to super 8.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: RedEarSlider
Reviews.Content: This place is just off Little Korea. It is close to fast food and grocery stores. The price wasn't bad and the parking is ok. The room was ok too until I took a shower. I had the front desk person coming up and telling me to keep the shower curtain inside to tub since the water was leaking downstairs. And all along I DID have the shower curtain inside the tub. Even if it wasn't it should not be an issue. No water should be leaking ANYWHERE. The staff was so rude that I would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice for the price!”
Reviews.Author: travelsocal
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this motel on 3 different occasions: August 2004, March 2006, and June 2007. Each time I encountered no problems. I am a 23 year old college student. Booked this trip as a getaway to Los Angeles. The room and bathroom were decent in size. As with most trips, I didn't spend a lot of time in my room. Don't count on any type of view. If you are on the top floor, you "may" actually get a glimpse of the Hollywood sign. I could almost see it on the 2nd floor, but there were trees/buildings in the way. The staff is friendly. I've read in some posts that it is in a "so-so" area of Hollywood. I can see where it may get a little sketchy late night. I didn't have any problems the times I was visiting. It is 2 blocks south from the Western/Hollywood metro rail. It's easy access to Hollywood/Highland area and downtown. There is a 24hr Walgreens next to it, and a McDonald's. For those who come back from the bar, and need to satisfy their appetite, there is actually a Subway open till 3am and a late night Denny's a few blocks West on Sunset. Both are in walking/stumbling distance. I highly recommend! The continental breakfast is okay - Better than most! They usually have muffins and doughnuts. I think they actually had cereal at one point. They have their own orange juice dispenser that I thoroughly enjoyed when I was hungover from partying the night before. (The best stuff ever! I couldn't get enough.) Like I said, it is conveniently located near the metro. Easy access the highland. I didn't have a car while I was out there - so I quickly became familar with the public transportation. A few blocks south of Sunset is Santa Monica Blvd. You can take the bus West to Santa Monica. It is about a 30-45 minute ride to the beach. I would recommend this hotel to others my age if you are just looking for a place to crash while you enjoy Los Angeles. I would definately stay there again in the future if I need a motel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location 20/10/08”
Reviews.Author: chicken
Reviews.Content: Great Location between Hollywood and Sunset Blvds. As a bonus we could see the Hollywood sign from our room on the 3rd floor!!!!!!! Room's were clean and spacious, breakfast was served downstairs - juice, coffee, pastries and cereals easy to find from the interstate.

Reviews.Title: “What a Dump”
Reviews.Author: bbbradk
Reviews.Content: Well after looking at the other reviews on this site, nobody will be surprised that this place is a real dump. We didn't so much choose to stay here so much as took a risk on a one star room on Hotwire and lost. The hotel is in a dodgy area (evidenced by the LAPD takedown we walked by one block from the hotel, oh, and the LAPD helicoptor that seemed to do loops around the hotel on a nightly basis) however I never felt personally threatened (but then I am a big guy). A few good points though. The lady at check in was very friendly, and knew the area pretty well. There is a 24 hour Walgreens right beside the hotel. The subway is a 2 block walk. The bad points far outnumber the good ones though. Since we were prepaid through Hotwire we were pretty well stuck here for 5 nights. On the first night my girlfriend couldn't take the stink of the room any longer and had to buy a few deodourizers at Walgreens just to try and chase the stench of smoke and sweat and filthy floor out of the room. The bed was hard as a rock, and only had 2 nasty pillows. The hallways were humid and stunk. Room was tiny, and while it did include a fridge, once we got our luggage into the room you couldn't access it. The aforementioned police activity in the area. The pay per minute internet in the lobby was dreadfully slow. I'll leave it at that and just say that this place should be avoided, it is nasty, and the reviews here saying it's nasty are years old, so the management obviously has taken no steps to better the property.

Reviews.Title: “Book elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Domenicd2000
Reviews.Content: -cramped - both bed area and bathroom as we had a room with 2 double beds which was clearly a single bed room converted -comes with a fridge but the room had no space to move around -bathroom shower curtain could use a change as it was dirty -relatively clean bed area but over priced for what is charged -4 floors with one elevator -comes with included wi-fi -the worse excuse for a breakfast included place - coffee, tea and stale sugar donuts that the homeless guy didn't even want -overall, would not recommend this place

Reviews.Title: “Good stay!”
Reviews.Author: TexasSiciliana
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 4 with small children, and planned our first sightseeing vacation to LA for August. When I won this motel on priceline and read some bad reviews, I was very concerned. But we actually had a good stay. Friendly staff, a clean ample room with fridge and coffee maker, a tub for us to soak in after a long day out, a decent free breakfast, access to a microwave 24hrs in the breakfast area for heating my sons milk and snacks, fast elevator, free parking, affordable internet accessin the lobby, all made this a perfectly adecuate motel for our needs and good value for the price we paid. Things to be improved were the rough sheets and towels, also the bathroom did not get cleaned very well, until I asked the cleaning lady. We would stay there again, if a hotel with pool was not available for the price we want to pay.

Reviews.Title: “THE NIGHTMARE HAS A NAME”
Reviews.Author: SweetyWien
Reviews.Content: The sheets were very, very dirty. The chair was filled with urine. Holes in the head cushion. The blanket was dirty. In the non-smoking room it smells like a smokehouse. We tried to change the blanket, but all others shown to us from the hotel employees were dirty too. it is the worst hotel I have ever seen.

Reviews.Title: “Preys on tourists!”
Reviews.Author: bigdog707
Reviews.Content: I definitely agree with the postings other people placed on this motel. Everything the website says on this motel are lies. First of all, the pictures they put on the website are totally deceiving. You can't see the Hollywood sign as they tell you, there are no free wireless in every room, there is a pay by the minute computer in the lobby which is sooooooo slow and old, the room stinks like pee, the floors are sticky, the bed is rock hard and bed sheets has stains on it, the fridge don't really work, the towels are old and stained, ice machine is on the second floor and vending machines doesn't work (makes no sense why they put vending machine on first floor and ice machine on second floor in a four story place), and the free breakfast they claim is made up of donuts, coffee and cereal. Most importantly, if they find out that you are a tourist, they will change the motel rates without warning. We have a AAA discount and they wouldn't honor it just because they don't want to honor it. Try and argue that over a bullet proof glass (no wonder). We found six other motels around the area and found very reasonable rates and more pleasant than this Super 8 dump.

Reviews.Title: “Stinky & Filthy Stay”
Reviews.Author: gingernichole
Reviews.Content: Wow where do I begin...upon arrival to the hotel we were checked in by a not so welcoming man. Exiting the elevator we enter the hallway and smell marijuana very strongly and see some kids sitting and smoking it. Once we get to our room we realize it is still dirty. Dirty as in full trash cans, smoky smell (this was supposed to be non-smoking), used soap in the bathroom, dirty sink and tables, dirty towels,unmade beds. But oddly enough the sheets did seem clean. This was very aggravating. But it was about 11:30pm and we realized that there was not a cleanig lady. I went a told the man downstairs that we needed it cleaned first thing in the morning. We then woke up early on our first day of vacation to let this happen. We stayed for four nights. The internet wi-fi was "down" the entire time. The refrigerator did not work. All of these things were unacceptable, but we did not complain. There were some good things such as the friendly housekeepers, the decent location (wouldnt recommend walking alone at night though), the nice sized room. I hate to be the person who leaves negative feedback, but i hope this can be helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Never Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: leafslover
Reviews.Content: NEVER STAY HERE!!! This place was absolutely DISGUSTING!!! Within 5 minutes of being in the room the toilet was clogged. The creepy guy who checked us in took 25 minutes to unclog it. The floor hadn't been vacuumed in about a week. There was candy wrappers on the floor along with change. Make-up remover was shoved behind the dirty little fridge. The bathroom was moldy and hadn't been cleaned. Bugs were found crawling in the bathroom. The sheets had wholes and stains on them, along with dirt at the bottom of the sheets. The customer service at the front desk was very poor and not at all interested in helping change rooms or anything else.

Reviews.Title: “You Get What You Pay For!”
Reviews.Author: YEM
Reviews.Content: I never complain and have tolerated many hotels in my journeys, but I must warn anybody planning on staying here - 'you get what you pay for'. As long as a place is clean and has the bare essentials, I am happy. My wife and I arrived Monday, August 6, 2007, around 10 pm. We needed somewhere to stay for a cheap price as we were just going to sleep and were leaving the next morning so we checked into the Super 8 for a price of $98 USD - Tax inc. That's a good price compared to what other hotels in the area are charging. The review: - Parking: You get free parking beside the hotel in a well-lit parking lot. I felt safe leaving our rental car there. Great because this is a shady part of Sunset Blvd. - Free Wireless Internet: Nice touch. - Room: The hall was smelly and dimly lit. As we opened the door to our room, I new we had made a mistake. It smelt like sweat and cigarette - seriously - very strong odour! A bad combo. The pillow cases had sweat stains on them, and the sheets were also stained with obvious signs of 'wear and tear'. A few 'hairs' here and there also on the white sheets. I opened the window to air out the room. The bathroom was clean, nothing special, and towels were paper thin. The entire room could just use some refurbishing and freshening up. The main issue though was the smell of sweat. It was as if it was stuck in the walls. My wife and I looked at each other and said 'oh well, it's only for a night' and went to a local restaurant for some eats. On our way back we were both dreading the room and strongly considered checking out for something more tolerable, but decided to just chalk it up as an experience. - Continental Breakfast Included: Cereal, warm milk, watery coffee... what can I say. We could see the HOLLYWOOD sign from our room, which was a surprise bonus, but this room was not what we were used to staying in. I would pay a little more and stay at one of the many motels a little west of this hotel on Sunset Blvd. This is a very last resort hotel. The pics on the internet of this hotel are very deceiving - they must have been taken 15 years ago when the hotel was brand spanking new because that IS NOT what the rooms look like. It's not the worst place in the world to stay, but it was tough to swallow. As the old saying goes, you get what you pay for - it rings true at this Super 8. The next day we checked into a $300/night hotel and it felt like walking into heaven when we opened the door to that room! Just be warned, and know before you go!

Reviews.Title: “A good reasonable priced and comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: EasyBizTrvlr
Reviews.Content: Hi. I stayed at Super 8 over the weekend.. since the plan was go around LA the central location was just too good ... the rent was pretty reasonable given the location and that the room was clean and comfy, the breakfast was decent and the reception was very very helpful from giving advice while planning my itirenary.... one small complaint was the room TV being stuck on a mexican channel at all times :-( .. but then.. one doesnt go to to hollywood to watch TV in the room.... Manu Tyagi

Reviews.Title: “Worst Place We've Ever Stayed, Absolutely Horrendous...”
Reviews.Author: Love2TravelOften
Reviews.Content: I have traveled quite a bit and have often stayed at Super 8 motels because most of them are fairly decent for the budget conscious traveler, but this Super 8 was truly a nightmare. I booked this hotel on the company's website. The pictures shown are nothing like the actual hotel! This hotel was located in a very shady neighborhood. There was a strip joint right next door and I also saw several hookers infront of our hotel! I agree with the previous review, this is not some place I would want to be even in daylight, let alone at night. Very scary area. That aside, the elevator they have is very, very slow and it felt as if it would break down any minute. There were stains all over the walls and carpets, not just in our room, but also along the dark hallways. Our bed sheets had weird stains, and the comforter had holes. Our room was supposed to be non-smoking, but it smelled very musty in our room. The toilet seat was falling to one side and the bathroom vent didn't work. When I complained at the front desk, the employee was not friendly and he did not seem to care. He didn't apoligize and he didn't move us to another room. He claimed that they didn't have any more rooms available, and he had a smirk on his face. The next day when I talked to the manager, she was able to move us to a better room, but even then the room wasn't much better. All of the windows outside their rooms have bars. At one point I had to question whether this was a prison or a hotel? I tried booking another room in the area, called all the hotels I could find, but they were all booked -- otherwise we would have been out of there the first day. It's been a few months and I still cringe when I think about how awful that motel was, it's beyond belief. I would never, ever stay there again, not even if they gave me a free night there. It's that bad.

Reviews.Title: “Not Nice...”
Reviews.Author: Erin947
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the super 8 with my boyfriend as we were doing a road trip up the west coast, we are very much budget travelers and the motel 8 sounded like a great location. That could not have been further from the truth. For the 15 minutes I sat in the car waiting for him to check in I saw 2 hookers and lots and lots of homeless people. It is definitley not a nice area to be in, I being a female would have been scared to walk around even in the daytime if my boyfriend had not been there, and wouldn't even think about venturing out at night. The room itself was ok, big bed, tv with lots of channels. The front desk staff were fairly friendly but were not very informed about things such as the "high speed internet in every room." As computer literate people we went downstairs to see about a password, no password and no help offered either only the computer downstairs which charged $10 for 10 minutes and the in the lobby which smells like indian food. You get what you pay for as far as budget hotels, however, we paid $65, not a lot of money, and were ripped off.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Ghetto”
Reviews.Author: D67
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't stay here again. It's in a really crappy part of town with not a lot around it. It's accessible to Hollywood, though. There's a Carls Jr. across the street and a drug store nearby but you'll probably be asked for change a few times getting there. The lobby smells really funny like 3 people were cooking 3 different meals. The elevator is really old and a piece of crap that takes 2 or 3 minutes to get from the 4th floor to the lobby. The maintenance guy is creepy. Looks like a creepier Neil Young. The room I stayed in was about a 2/10. It was fairly big but had an old TV, funny smells, bad fluorescent lighting, weird funky holes in the ceiling, stains on the walls, and various unknown stains splattered all over the bathroom wall - don't ask. The girl the front desk is nice - but they generally don't know much and can't guide you on anything. The breakfast is terrible - stale gross donuts and bad coffee/juice. Mostly looks like families and out of towners stay there... I wouldn't go back. I wouldnt recommend unless you just want a cheap place to stay that's not full of hookers.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Kerkie
Reviews.Content: My teenage daughter and I stayed here for three nights. The room was clean, comfortable and more than adequate. The parking lot could use more space as our rental car was an unasked-for SUV; I was told they would park it in a gated space behind the motel if there was no room in the lot. This was not necessary, but I appeciated their effort. We received a copy of the LA Times each morning by our door which was also appreciated. The neighborhood has a Walgreen's and a McDonald's, plus a grocery nearby. It is almost on the corner of Sunset Boulevard and close to Hollywood Boulevard. The neighborhood seemed safe enough. The staff was attentive and wanted to make our stay happy. If you are looking for an inexpensive, safe and clean motel near Hollywood this would be a good place to stay. Our room looked out over the back neighborhood and it was quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Not Exactly Near Hollywood & Vine”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: You DO need a car if you're planning to do the Hollywood / Beverly Hills experience, but you'd better get a compact. The hotel parking lot looks like it was designed specifically for a lot full of Chevettes, Neons, or Fiestas. The hotel is about 2 miles from Hollywood and Vine - the hub of Hollywood. Do not expect coffee before 7 or danishes/doughnuts before 8. Do not expect to check in early. The elevator is scary - it has not been inspected since January 2004. The room was fine; it's standard Super 8 quality. I have no complaints or compliments. It was an uneventful stay. Also, do NOT buy a star's homes map; go on a tour. The map you buy will be old, dead semi-stars. It will not include the likes of Julia Roberts or Tom Hanks; more like the old homes of mostly people you've never heard of.

Reviews.Title: “A monk's bed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is one of those places that looks a lot better on paper than it actually is. I spent 4 nights there - Monday 3/15/04 to Friday 3/19/04. I originally selected this place because it had a refrigarator in the room. "Great," I thought, I can save money by buying sandwiches instead of going to a resturant. Sure enough the room had a refrigarator, a 2.1 cu ft "bar" model, which preformed like a champ. Too bad there were several other things that were less than optimal. The motel lists cable TV as one of its perks. Unfortunately half the cable channels were out of order when I was there, downcheck. The Queen bed was like sleeping on a steel shelf or a monk's rock bed. I mean sure some people like a firm mattress, but this was beyond firm, to the point of being more like a mideval torcher device, downcheck. The room WAS soundproof. A good thing too because it was right next door to an active construction site, with +90 db noise from 6am to after sunset. Thank God for sound proofing. Up Check. There are three supermarkets, including a Ralph's and a Food 4 Less within two blocks of the motel, and there is a Sav-On drugstore a half block away. Easy to stock the refrigarator. Up check. But the worst thing was there was NO radio reception there. There was a clock radio in the room and I had brought my own boombox. Both AM and FM bands were wiped out with a loud 60 Hz buzz. Maybe from construction site. But for someone like me who likes to listen to the radio in the wee hours this was the thing that made this four-day mini-vacation a huge waste of time for me.

Reviews.Title: “Slums of Los Angeles/Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First and foremost the pictures posted of the place is false!!! The lobby looks the same as the picture, but the bedrooms are another issue. Second, I booked a deluxe room, non-smoking, king-sized bed...what I got was a nasty rat hole. Cigarette burns in blankets, on furniture, stains on walls, showerhead was broken, sink faucet was leaking, elevator inspection is over due and sometimes gets stuck between floors, flood on the 4th floor, and the fire alarm rang 3 hours throughout the night because of the flood, and took 2 room changes to be put in a "decent" room.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed in June 2004. Room was infested with bedbugs. Manager was unwilling to refund. Horrible experience. streaks all over sheets in morning.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and fine but you need a car”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for four nights because I got a cheap rate over the internet. It's near Hollywood Boulevard which I thought must be a good location, but it's not. Actually it's a very grotty area and it is very hard ot get anywhere decent from there. But if you have a car, as I did once I realised how important it was, then it's fine. The hotel room was big and clean. The breakfast is just a tray of sugary donuts dumped in the lobby - I only got it once because I kept sleeping in. Anyway the foyer is a bit smelly but fine, the staff were all friendly enough. You can access the internet in the lobby for a fee, pretty cheaply I believe. Oh and they don't have real milk for coffee - just a jar of powdery white stuff instead. As I say, if you have a car and can get out of the area easily - go for it. Cheers

HotelInfo.Name: Super 8 Hollywood
HotelInfo.Address: 1536 North Western Avenue, Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
